name: Multisystem Senile Degeneration with Paradoxical Hyperkinesia
chief_complaint: I can't stop moving but I feel like my body is falling apart
physical_findings: Dermatomal sensory loss in T4-T6 distribution
treatment: Physical therapy with weighted garments for movement control
PEG tube placement for nutritional support
prognosis: Progressive deterioration expected over 3-5 years with eventual complete loss of motor control
description: A rare neurodegenerative condition combining features of Wilson's disease, Huntington's chorea, and frontotemporal dementia. Characterized by copper metabolism dysfunction causing basal ganglia degeneration while paradoxically inducing hyperkinetic movements. Typically presents in patients >75 with previously undiagnosed heterozygous ATP7B mutations.
risk_factors: History of occupational heavy metal exposure
